info.title: AuthorizationManagementClient
info.description: Role based access control provides you a way to apply granular level policy administration down to individual resources or resource groups. These operations enable you to manage role assignments. A role assignment grants access to Azure Active Directory users.

put.description: Creates a role assignment schedule request.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the role assignment schedule request to create. The scope can be any REST resource instance. For example, use '/providers/Microsoft.Subscription/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/' for a subscription, '/providers/Microsoft.Subscription/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}' for a resource group, and '/providers/Microsoft.Subscription/subscriptions/{subscription-id}/resourceGroups/{resource-group-name}/providers/{resource-provider}/{resource-type}/{resource-name}' for a resource.

parameters.name: roleAssignmentScheduleRequestName
parameters.description: The name of the role assignment to create. It can be any valid GUID.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.description: Parameters for the role assignment schedule request.

201.description: Created - Returns information about the role assignment.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Get the specified role assignment schedule request.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the role assignment schedule request.

parameters.name: roleAssignmentScheduleRequestName
parameters.description: The name (guid) of the role assignment schedule request to get.

200.description: OK - Returns information about the role assignment schedule request.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

get.description: Gets role assignment schedule requests for a scope.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the role assignments schedule requests.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: The filter to apply on the operation. Use $filter=atScope() to return all role assignment schedule requests at or above the scope. Use $filter=principalId eq {id} to return all role assignment schedule requests at, above or below the scope for the specified principal. Use $filter=asRequestor() to return all role assignment schedule requests requested by the current user. Use $filter=asTarget() to return all role assignment schedule requests created for the current user. Use $filter=asApprover() to return all role assignment schedule requests where the current user is an approver.

200.description: OK - Returns an array of role assignments schedule requests.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

post.description: Cancels a pending role assignment schedule request.

parameters.name: scope
parameters.description: The scope of the role assignment request to cancel.

parameters.name: roleAssignmentScheduleRequestName
parameters.description: The name of the role assignment request to cancel.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation failed.

principalId.description: Returns role assignment requests of the specific principal.

roleDefinitionId.description: Returns role assignment requests of the specific role definition.

requestorId.description: Returns role assignment requests created by specific principal.

status.description: Returns role assignment requests of specific status.

scope.description: The role assignment schedule request scope.

principalType.description: The principal type of the assigned principal ID.

requestType.description: The type of the role assignment schedule request. Eg: SelfActivate, AdminAssign etc

status.description: The status of the role assignment schedule request.

approvalId.description: The approvalId of the role assignment schedule request.

targetRoleAssignmentScheduleId.description: The resultant role assignment schedule id or the role assignment schedule id being updated

targetRoleAssignmentScheduleInstanceId.description: The role assignment schedule instance id being updated

startDateTime.description: Start DateTime of the role assignment schedule.

type.description: Type of the role assignment schedule expiration

endDateTime.description: End DateTime of the role assignment schedule.

duration.description: Duration of the role assignment schedule in TimeSpan.

expiration.description: Expiration of the role assignment schedule

scheduleInfo.description: Schedule info of the role assignment schedule

linkedRoleEligibilityScheduleId.description: The linked role eligibility schedule id - to activate an eligibility.

ticketNumber.description: Ticket number for the role assignment

ticketSystem.description: Ticket system name for the role assignment

ticketInfo.description: Ticket Info of the role assignment

condition.description: The conditions on the role assignment. This limits the resources it can be assigned to. e.g.: @Resource[Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts/blobServices/containers:ContainerName] StringEqualsIgnoreCase 'foo_storage_container'

conditionVersion.description: Version of the condition. Currently accepted value is '2.0'

createdOn.description: DateTime when role assignment schedule request was created

requestorId.description: Id of the user who created this request

expandedProperties.description: Additional properties of principal, scope and role definition

RoleAssignmentScheduleRequestProperties.description: Role assignment schedule request properties with scope.

id.description: The role assignment schedule request ID.

name.description: The role assignment schedule request name.

type.description: The role assignment schedule request type.

nextLink.description: The URL to use for getting the next set of results.

RoleAssignmentScheduleRequestListResult.description: Role assignment schedule request list operation result.

CloudError.description: An error response from the service.

code.description: An identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.

message.description: A message describing the error, intended to be suitable for display in a user interface.

CloudErrorBody.description: An error response from the service.

displayName.description: Display name of the role definition

ApiVersionParameter.name: api-version
ApiVersionParameter.description: The API version to use for this operation.
